metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8546 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer underflow in libavcodec/cinepak.c in FFmpeg before 2.4.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted Cinepak video data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8546` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.5.4-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.5.4-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavcodec57 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavdevice57 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:2.5.4-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavfilter6 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavformat57 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavresample3 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavutil55 - 7:2.5.4-1
libpostproc54 - 7:2.5.4-1
libswresample2 - 7:2.5.4-1
libswscale4 - 7:2.5.4-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> I do not trust this patch

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.5.4-1').
